content: I love it. But this is where I get stuck… “Should We Have A Moral Responsibility To Refugees?”From your story it’s easy to say, “yes, of course.” I’ve heard other similar stories and my heart shouts and squirms and says, “these are people; help them! Show them rescue.” But when I hear the question from a governmental/policy perspective it isn’t the same. I don’t have the heart strings to a policy, I have heart strings to people. So, while I’m comfortable saying we, our country, our people have a moral responsibility to help others, I do not have that same comfort saying our country as a government has that responsibility because as an organized government it has a tightly defined responsibility to its citizens and that responsibility is always at risk of great conflicts of interest when other ‘responsibilities’ are suggested, mandated, or thrust upon it. So, to answer your question, and in light of your story, yes, and yet in some ways, no.
